com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class SchedulerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.SchedulerUtils

  • public class SchedulerUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utilities common to the construction and operation of Mesos Schedulers.

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceName

        public static java.lang.String getServiceName(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
        Returns the configured service name (aka framework name) to use for running the service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no service name could be found

      • withEscapedSlashes

        public static java.lang.String withEscapedSlashes(java.lang.String frameworkName)
        Removes any slashes from the provided framework name and replaces them with double underscores. For example:
        • /path/to/kafka => path__to__kafka
        • path/to/some-kafka => path__to__some-kafka
        • path__to__kafka => EXCEPTION
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided framework name already contains double underscores

      • getServiceRole

        public static java.lang.String getServiceRole(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
        Returns the configured Mesos role to use for running the service. For example: /path/to/kafka => path__to__kafka-role

      • getServicePrincipal

        public static java.lang.String getServicePrincipal(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
        Returns the configured Mesos principal to use for running the service.

      • getZkHost

        public static java.lang.String getZkHost(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec,
                                         SchedulerConfig schedulerConfig)
        Returns the configured hostname:port to use for state storage at the scheduler.

      • getUser

        public static java.lang.String getUser(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
        Returns the configured user to use for running the scheduler.

      • hardExit

        public static void hardExit(SchedulerErrorCode errorCode)
        Immediately exits the process with the ordinal value of the provided errorCode.
